metadata.title: CVE-2012-0799 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.7 and 2.1.x before 2.1.4, when an anonymousfront-page forum is enabled, allows remote attackers to obtain session keysfor their sessions by visiting the front page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

moodle - 2.2.2.dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: moodle package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2.dfsg-2').
